snippet: A study issued on Wednesday suggests why many Americans remain glum even though the economy is growing and unemployment has declined.
abstract: Study by former Census Bureau officials says that median household income has begun to recover over the last two years, but households still have not come close to regaining the purchasing power they had before the financial crisis began; suggests why many people remain glum even though the economy is growing and unemployment has declined.
lead_paragraph: A study issued on Wednesday suggests why many Americans remain glum even though the economy is growing and unemployment has declined.

headline.main: Median Income Rises, but Is Still 6% Below Level at Start of Recession in ’07
headline.print_headline: Median Income Rises, but Is Still 6% Below Level at Start of Recession in ’07
